info.title: Deadlines API
info.description:
Returns shipment deadlines for each terminal based on a specific Vessel IMO Number/Voyage Number/Port of Load combination

# Overview
This service returns 6 shipment deadlines for each terminal based on a specific Vessel/Voyage/Port of Load combination:
* Commercial Cargo Cutoff,
* Commercial Verified Gross Mass Deadline,
* Shipping Instructions Deadlines
* Shipping Instructions Deadline for Advance Manifest Cargo (cutoff for AMS transmission countries - USA, Canada, EU, CCAM)
* Special Cargo Documentation Deadline.
* Dangerous Goods Declaration Deadline.
* Empty Container Pickup Deadline.

# Who can get access?
All registered users of the Maersk Developer Portal can get access to the API.

# How many calls can I make?
Traffic and spike arrest limits are configured at the consumer key level for each API Product as detailed in the table below. If these limits are exceeded, the request is rejected with a 429 Too Many Requests HTTP status code.

| Quota per Consumer Key | Traffic Surge Rate Limit per Consumer Key |
|------------------------|-------------------------------------------|
| 2000 calls per hour    | 60 calls per minute                       |

# Release Notes
| Version | Date | Notes |
|---------|------|-------|
| 2.3.0   | 2026-01-30 | added support for UNLocationCode |
| 2.2.0   | 2026-01-12 | enabled Empty Container Pickup Deadline |
| 2.1.0   | 2024-07-25 | enabled Dangerous Goods Declaration Deadline |
| 2.0.2   | 2023-05-19 | updated the response schema |
| 2.0.1   | 2022-04-08 | fixed examples and security scheme |
| 2.0.0   |      | Initial Draft |

get.description:
Returns the deadlines for a specific Vessel IMO Number/Voyage Number/Port of Load combination.

This endpoint requires **ONE OF** the following combinations of parameters to identify a Port of Load location:
1. `UNLocationCode` (mandatory)
2. `ISOCountryCode` (mandatory) + `portOfLoad` (mandatory)

parameters.name: UNLocationCode
parameters.description:
The UN Location code of the Port of Load.

The pattern used must be:

- 2 characters for the country code using [ISO 3166-1
alpha-2](https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#iso:pub:PUB500001:en)
- 3 characters to code a location within that country. Letters A-Z
and numbers from 2-9 can be used

More info can be found here:
[UN/LOCODE](https://unece.org/trade/cefact/UNLOCODE-Download)

parameters.name: ISOCountryCode
parameters.description:
Two-letter country code defined in the ISO 3166-1 standard published by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO)
https://www.iso.org/iso-3166-country-codes.html

parameters.name: portOfLoad
parameters.description:
Name of the Port of Load (name of City) as defined by the UNECE
https://www.unece.org/cefact/codesfortrade/codes_index.html

parameters.name: vesselIMONumber
parameters.description:
The IMO number of the vessel as defined by the Internation Maritime Organization
http://www.imo.org/en/Pages/Default.aspx

parameters.name: voyage
parameters.description: The voyage number for the vessel

400.description: Bad request; the request is unacceptable often due to a missing or invalid parameter.

401.description: The client cannot be authenticated by the system

403.description: The client does not have permissions to access this endpoint

404.description: The requested resource cannot be found

method.description: The request method type e.g. GET, POST.

status.description: The textual representation of the response status.

timestamp.description: The date and time (dd-MM-yyyy hh:mm:ss) the error occured.

subErrors.description: The list of invalid fields in the request.

field.description: The field that has failed validation.

rejectedValue.description: The value that has failed validation.

message.description: The reason and advice for failed validation.

ShipmentDeadlines.description: The list of deadlines for each terminal for the specific Vessel/Voyage/Port of Load combination provided by the consumer.

terminalName.description: The name of the terminal for the Port of Load requested

deadlineLocal.description: The deadline timestamp for the local time zone that is calculated based on a fixed offset to an event time which can either be the (proforma or scheduled) ETA or ETD of a port call or another deadline.

ApiKeyHeader.name: Consumer-Key
ApiKeyHeader.description: The Consumer Key issued for your registered application must be provided with every request
